definition: becquerel (unit of radioactivity, symbol Bq)/abbr. to 貝克|贝克[bei4 ke4]
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux

sentences.english: In fact, the first found to be a man named Henri Becquerel.
sentences.chinese: 其实，最早发现是一个名叫贝克勒尔的人。

definition: Wilhelm Conrad Röntgen (1845-1923), German mechanical engineer
Rutherford (name)/Ernest Rutherford (1871-1937), early nuclear physicist from New Zealand
Antoine Lavoisier (1743-1794), French nobleman and scientist, considered the father of modern chemistry
see 居禮夫人|居礼夫人[Ju1 li3 Fu1 ren5]
Lord Kelvin 1824-1907, British physicist (William Thomson)/Kelvin (temperature scale)
Henri Poincaré (1854-1912), French mathematician, physician and philosopher
Louis Pasteur (1822-1895), French chemist and microbiologist
